description: Stores single response data for College of American Pathologists (CAP) form 76062-UTERINE CERVIX: Excision.

columns.name: RESULT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the result record.

columns.name: TUMOR_SITE_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify tumor site.

columns.name: CAP_COMMENTS
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: General comments.

columns.name: SPEC_PROC_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify the Specimen Procedure.

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_GREAT
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Greatest Size.

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_ADDL
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Size (length).

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_ADDL2
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Size (width).

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Tumor Size.

columns.name: SPECIMEN_OTHER_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify other specimen.

columns.name: ADDL_PATH_FIND_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify additional pathologic findings.

columns.name: HISTOLOGIC_GRADE_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Histologic Grade.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Not applicable


GX: Cannot be assessed


G1: Well differentiated


G2: Moderately differentiated


G3: Poorly differentiated


G4: Undifferentiated


G4: Undifferentiated / anaplastic


WHO grade not assigned


Low-grade (well-differentiated to moderately differentiated)


High-grade (poorly differentiated to undifferentiated)


FIGO Grade 1


FIGO Grade 2


FIGO Grade 3


Favorable (purely epithelial, fetal subtype, mitotically inactive with <=2 mitoses in


Less favorable (all subtypes other than those designated "Favorable" or "Unfavorable"


Unfavorable (small cell undifferentiated or rhabdoid as the predominant or sole histo


Gleason Pattern


Ungraded sarcoma


pGX: Grade cannot be assessed


pG1: Spindle cell melanoma


pG2: Mixed cell melanoma


pG3: Epithelioid cell melanoma


WHO Grade I


WHO Grade II


WHO Grade III


WHO Grade IV


pG1: Well differentiated


pG2: Moderately differentiated


pG3: Poorly differentiated


pG4: Undifferentiated


FNCLCC Grade 1


FNCLCC Grade 2


FNCLCC Grade 3


Grade 1


Grade 2


Grade 3


Cannot be determined


Other

columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify other or nonclassifiable histologic type.

columns.name: HIST_TP_ADCCNM_OS
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify other details for Histologic Type Adenocarcinoma.

columns.name: STRML_INVSN_HRZL_XT
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Stromal Invasion Horizontal Extent.

columns.name: ENDC_MG_CNNT_ASSD_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Endocervical Margin invasive carcinoma.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Not involved by invasive carcinoma


Involved by invasive carcinoma


Not involved by intraepithelial squamous neoplasia


Involved by intraepithelial squamous neoplasia


Not involved by adenocarcinoma in situ


Involved by adenocarcinoma in situ

columns.name: ENDC_MG_IVLV_IC_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Endocervical Margin Involved by Invasive Carcinoma.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Focal


Diffuse

columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Distance of Invasive Carcinoma from Margin for Not involved by invasive carcinoma when Exocervical Margin cannot be assessed.
